runs.comm: flatter delivery, keeps coming in with the angle from round the wicket. The batsman chops it to point
first runs on the board as the batsman pushes the flighted delivery to long on
comes down the pitch and drives this full delivery straight back at the bowler
pushed through, this is brilliantly cut in front of point for a boundary! There was hardly any room in that and Raza bent backwards to create some.
slider to follow from the bowler, the batsman gets hit on the pads as he looks to play it to the leg
again on the pads, the batsman looks to clip it but gets hit high on the pads
fuller and lacking in pace and intent, the batsman's chip to long on is no better, limp response to a loose ball
length delivery on the pads, he nudges it to square leg for a single

that has gone through Masakadza! This rocks the middle stump! The batsman skipped down the pitch and looked for the big shot over the bowler's head, but that snuck under his bat and hit the top of middle. No threatening pace, but that's one advantage of keeping it straight
on the pads, some inward movement for Guruge too. The batsman gets a leading edge to cover
take that Guruge! Taylor gets going with a golfswing over mid-off. It was a fullish delivery and he just lifted it with ease
he dabs it to cover and calls for a quick single to keep strike
doesn't offer too much flight as he keeps it wicket to wicket. Defended
swept off middle. Solid strike from the captain. Enough pace on that ball to be sent packing to the backward square leg boundary

moves outside leg and he's lofted this just about over the man at long-on. Rather short boundary there as he goes through with the shot. Didn't get all of it, but gets the benefit for his recklessness
not so lucky this time. Cleared his front leg and lifted it over the top. Mid-off ran back and picks up a smart catch over his shoulder. Was looking to do a bit too much
goes on with the arm as this is flatter on middle and leg. Tucked towards square leg
tossed up on middle and leg, moves outside off and ramps it fine. Short fine leg races after it and keeps to two.
this ducks back in and Williams is cut in half. Good length ball has him in two minds about his foot work. Tentative defensive, but he plays outside the line
inches forward to drive this length ball on the up. Doesn't get it as well as he hoped

beauty! This was a slower ball and Williams was sucked into it. The flick across the line ends up becoming a leading edge which Guruge claims with glee. Drew him forward with that in between length again
fullish on off stump, comes forward and blocks to mid-off
another leading edge as the batsman looks to flick a length ball outside leg. Into the stroke a bit too soon
fullish and just outside off, excellent line again. Defended with an open face. One run off the over and a wicket as well
good length ball with little room on offer, pushed down to long-on
no turn for Shadeep yet. This was tossed up on leg stump and skidded along. He was late in his stroke and wears it on the thigh
length ball pushed into him, goes back and pushes into the leg side
shortish on middle and off, straightens just a bit as the batsman rocks back and punches between cover and mid-off
flighted on off stump, strides forward to defend
short and a bit of room on offer, cut away just in front of point
good length ball on and around off stump, defended towards point
walks across and heaves the length ball angling away to deep midwicket. Risky shot, nicely played
fullish just outside off, defended with an open face
good length ball on off stump, Sibanda is drawn forward to defend
back of a length and it comes on with a bit of extra bounce. Sibanda is on the back foot and punches to mid-off
fullish on off stump, steered to short third man
slower and tossed up on middle, Sibanda blocks with soft hands and sneaks a quick single into the covers
backs away and cuts off the stumps to deep cover
lovely ball. Tossed up with noticeable decrease in pace. Sibanda is drawn forward and blocks. Gets more of an inside edge though as he played too early
wanted to ramp, but this good length ball rises a little more. He adjusts to it and picks up a single to deep fine leg

races down the track and slices this to deep point! Raza's flight is the perfect lure and Sikandar cannot help himself. Goes for the swing over cover and gets it more off the bottom of the bat. The man in the deep runs in and picks up a smart, sliding catch
flighted on middle and leg, kept out
starts off with a poor one. Length ball angled on the pads, Chigumbura clears his front leg and swipes it over the head of deep square leg. Meaty blow
slapped through extra! That was brutal! Too short and too wide this time and Chigumbura stayed leg side of it and powered it away.
fullish and just outside off, Chigumbura goes for an almighty heave straight over the bowler's head. But he was playing down the wrong line
this has width and Chigumbura is in a mood! Strides forward and carves this over cover. There's no one in the deep. Third boundary of the over
full and straight, that suits his field better. Worked towards midwicket for a single
fullish on off stump, Sibanda presents an eye-catching punch to cover on the 30-yard circle
he has to wait ages and ages and when he does connect it's off the outside edge. Such a good pace on a slow pitch. Tossed it up but he stays back and cuts
uses the bowler's flight to his advantage. Races down the track to get under the ball and loft it over the top of the bowler's head. Clean strike
driven through the covers for a single. Good stride forward again
he is not messing about! This was quicker and flatter but Chigumbura rocks back and pummels this through the covers
stays back and nudges to deep midwicket. Shortish ball angled into him and it was well negotiated
tossed up on leg stump, chipped over the leg side and a little wide of long-on

doubt this was what was discussed! full toss struck back at the bowler and Khurram snaffles it! Advances at him first ball and having turned this into a juicy full toss, he just drives it straight back into the UAE captain's waiting hands
tossed up on off stump as Maruma, the new batsman, blocks. Gets an inside edge onto pad
has a foray down the track which helps him get to the pitch and drives wonderfully through the covers. All along the ground.
races down the track, but this time he hadn't reached the pitch. Still had no trouble slicing it over the covers. Big gap there and he knew it by how much room he made for himself
advances again, but this time its quicker and flatter on middle. Can only defend
definite change in tactics here, flatter ball defended
oh dear, he's dropped it short on middle and leg and this has been carted away to the midwicket boundary. Help yourself bowling this
full toss on off stump, keeps leg side of it and creams it through extra cover. Chigumbura is smoking it to all parts
much better. This is the length Raza has success with. Looped up on middle and leg and lures the batsman to sweep. Too soon into the stroke and missles
saw him coming down so he pulls it back. But this was still nice and slow and keeps the batsman honest. Bit of chat between batsman and bowler there
nudged through straight midwicket and they are racing between the wickets. In comes the throw and the dive saves him.
waits on the good length ball on off stump and guides it to point
wrong line there. It was nice and full, but he strays on the pads and Chigumbura has tickled it very fine. No stopping that. Simple boundary to long leg
fullish and just outside off, he clears his front leg and pushes to mid-off

dropped, and that must sting in more ways than one. It was Khurram himself. Not the best ball as it was short on off stump. Chigumbura made room and slaps into the covers and as ever doesn't bother keeping it down. Comes at an awkward chest height and he spills it
slower ball outside off, adjusts to it and steers towards short third man
another slower ball, this one fuller on off stump. Pushed to point off the open face
pace off the ball seems to be the norm. Length ball on off stump, defended square on the off side

flicked to deep midwicket and the batsman at the keeper's end has raced down for the extra run! But the throw is at the wrong end. And worse the backing up wasn't up the mark. The bowler was pointing at the keeper's end but deep midwicket was blind to the chance. Deaf, rather. He signals he didn't hear the call
length ball on middle and leg, swung away to deep midwicket and it falls short of the man
worked away into the leg side. Flick proving profitable
slower ball off the back of the hand, Maruma slogs to deep midwicket
length ball with a bit of room outside off. Chigumbura set himself up for the swat but he gets it off the toe. Bat turns in his hand
leg cutter and he has spotted it so very early! Stayed back and slapped it over the head of long-on. There's his power on display again
dug in short and it is outside off, Maruma goes for the pull and gets a top edge which flies off to the third man boundary
fullish on middle and leg, Maruma slogs to deep midwicket.
fullish on middle and leg, whipped away towards the deep midwicket boundary. Chips down the track to get momentum into the stroke and the man pulls out a well-timed boot

fullish on middle and off, Chigumbura clears his front leg and pounds this for six straight down the ground to get his fifty and wins the game. Zimbabwe top the group with a better run-rate than Ireland, at the moment
